thread.title: Three candidates vying for vacant West Linn City Council seat
thread.title_full: Three candidates vying for vacant West Linn City Council seat

author: Rick Bella | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Three candidates vying for vacant West Linn City Council seat
text:
Comments 
West Linn voters will fill a vacant City Council seat in the Nov. 3 election. 
The council seat was vacated after Russ Axelrod was elected mayor in May, defeating fellow Councilor Thomas Frank. The council then agreed to let voters decide in the November general election who would succeed Axelrod and fill the seat. 
On the ballot are: Robert Martin , 71, owner of Software Management Consulting . He previously worked as engineering manager for Tektronix and was an independent software developer. Martin formerly served on the West Linn Planning Commission. Martin holds a bachelor's degree in mathematics from the University of Central Florida and a master's degree and doctorate from Portland State University in engineering management and system science, respectively. Mike Selvaggio , 34, a lobbyist for Audubon Society of Portland , the Working Families Party and the Oregon Coalition of Police and Sheriffs . He also formerly worked in several state senate offices and served as a policy director for the last two state treasurers. He currently serves as president of the Willamette Neighborhood Association and on the West Linn Historical Society board. He earned a bachelor's degree in political science from the University of California, San Diego. Casey Stroupe , 46, president and owner of S&H Landscape Supplies & Recycling and Stroupe Family Farm , and co-owner of Clackamas Compost Products . He has no prior governmental experience. He holds a bachelor's degree in business from the University of Oregon. 
More information is available by visiting Clackamas County Elections Division's online Voters' Pamphlet .
